author: ajsutton
content:
For the `TransitionConfigurationV1`, it seems that post-merge Geth starts returning the details of the terminal block and not the `TERMINAL_BLOCK_HASH` and `TERMINAL_BLOCK_NUMBER` overrides. This causes warnings from Teku because the config doesn't match. And if the CL has had to resync then it wouldn't know the terminal block that was selected and so would always warn that the configuration was wrong.

Am I wrong in my understanding that `TransitionConfigurationV1` should be returning the config (overrides) and not the chain state?

author: ajsutton
content: The aim is to just confirm, prior to bellatrix actually happening, that the CL and EL have the same config and more importantly that the URL to the EL was actually right and the EL is actually contactable.  Once bellatrix is enable the CL starts regularly talking to the EL so it becomes less important and then once the actual merge transition happens there's no need for the config call at all because if it wasn't configured right blocks wouldn't be importing and you couldn't follow the chain.

author: ajsutton
content: Teku will stop requesting the config entirely once the merge transition goes through, except that if you have to resync then you may wind up back pre-transition again which is what happened to me today.
